Detailed Description

Defines rectangular constraints (of the form D*z <= d) for the ZMP.

Note:
D is a [4 x 2] matrix stored column-wise (Fortran style). D is always initialized as (later it could be rotated using D*R'): 
    D[0] =  1.0; D[4] =  0.0;
    D[1] =  0.0; D[5] =  1.0;
    D[2] = -1.0; D[6] =  0.0;
    D[3] =  0.0; D[7] = -1.0;

Default constructor.

NAO constraint with safety margin.

Definition at line 22 of file rect_constraint.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

void RectangularConstraint_ZMP::Constraints2Vert ( )

Computes the vertices of a polygon from the constraints (D*x <= d)

Note:
It is assumed that D is a [4 x 2] matrix stored column-wise.

The numbering of the vertices is (see the definition of d0) 

    3---------2
    |         |
    |         |
    4---------1
Note:
I am too lazy to check whether det = 0 :).

void RectangularConstraint_ZMP::rotate_translate ( double  ca,
double  sa,
Point2D  p 
)

translates from [0;0] to "p" and rotates from 0 to "angle". The 0 initial angle implies that D = [eye(2); -eye(2)].

Parameters:
[in]cacos(angle)
[in]sasin(angle)
[in]p2D point
Note:
This is used when the constraints are initialized (only then the orientation can be set).

[in]_dVector of the PoS constraints (assumed to be [4 x 1]).

Definition at line 37 of file rect_constraint.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

double RectangularConstraint_ZMP::D[4 *2]

Matrix of the constraints D*z <= d (where z is a 2D point). This variable is formed internaly.

Note:
D is a [4 x 2] matrix stored column-wise (Fortran style). D takes the form 
            D = [ 1  0;
                  0  1;
                 -1  0;
                  0 -1] * [cos(a) -sin(a)
                           sin(a)  cos(a)].

Definition at line 67 of file rect_constraint.h.

double RectangularConstraint_ZMP::d[4]

Vector of the constraints D*z <= d (where z is a 2D point). This variable is formed internaly.

Note:
d is a [4 x 1] vector. d takes the form d = d0 - D*p. p is a 2D reference point (expressed with respect to the world frame) for the rectangular constraint (see the sketch for d0).

Definition at line 94 of file rect_constraint.h.

double RectangularConstraint_ZMP::d0[4]

Size of the support polygon for a single support (USER INPUT) 

             ------------------------------------------------
             |                    |                         |
             |                    |d0(2)                    |
             |                    |                         |
             |      d0(3)         |          d0(1)          |
             |------------------- p ------------------------|
             |                    |                         |
             |                    |                         |
             |                    |d0(4)                    |
             |                    |                         |
             ------------------------------------------------
